post_text:
IMPORTANT: The June board meeting is on the calendar for Monday, June 8th but this is a misprint.

The board meeting is scheduled for June 1 at 7pm in the Grade School Library.

USD 227 is following the Governor's reopen plan so in person patron participation is limited to 5 due to there already being 10 people at the board meeting (7 members, 2 administrators and 1 clerk). You may watch the meeting on Zoom. Log in information can be found on the front page of the school website at www.usd227.org.

Thank you.

post_text:
Parents:

I just wanted to give you a quick update. We are currently working on what educating our students will look like.

We are needing to gather a little information from you in order for us to move forward and any information you provide will be kept confidential. The survey link is below and we would appreciate 100% participation. It will also be on the school website and on our school Facebook page. Please only fill it out one time.

We know your students have belongings in the buildings still and we are working on a solution to get those back to you. Please be patient with us as we get this all sorted out.

https://forms.gle/Ugk8vCRrwyTF4qSp9

post_text:
USD 227 Patrons:

As we just heard from the governor, school as we know it has been closed through May. We are still required to get instruction to our students in some manner. We do not know how this will look as of now, but we are going to be getting some direction from the state over the next several days on how to best serve our students. I ask that you please stay patient with me as we work through this to find the best solution to meet our community's needs.

Sincerely,
Doug Chaney
USD 227 Superintendent
text:

I ask that you please stay patient with me as we work through this to find the best solution to meet our community's needs.

Sincerely,
Doug Chaney
USD 227 Superintendent

post_text:
At 4:00 pm today, Kansas Department of Education (KSDE) highly recommended that all schools be closed next week.

With this new recommendation, USD 227 schools will be closed for the week of March 16-20. All activities, practices, and parent/teacher conferences are cancelled and will be rescheduled at a later date. School will resume on March 30th.

This is still a fluid situation and more information will be put out as we receive it. Thank you for your cooperation and understanding.

With this new recommendation, USD 227 schools will be closed for the week of March 16-20. All activities, practices, and parent/teacher conferences are cancelled and will be rescheduled at a later date. School will resume on March 30th.

This is still a fluid situation and more information will be put out as we receive it. Thank you for your cooperation and understanding.

post_text:
Parents, Faculty and Staff:

In the event of inclimate weather, every attempt is made to get word out quickly and we have come to rely on getting a phone call or an email from our ADT system. As with all technology, it sometimes has a glitch or just simply fails. If you think there is a possibility that school will be cancelled or postponed and you haven't gotten a call, please check the television stations and the Hodgeman County Schools Facebook page. We are going to try to get it put on the Rocking M radio stations as well. I sincerely apologize to those that did not get a call recently that we were having a late start. If one avenue fails, we always have a backup so please check all available methods. If you don't get a call, please phone me at 620-357-8301 to let me know. Thank you.

Christina Cohoon
text:
Parents, Faculty and Staff:

In the event of inclimate weather, every attempt is made to get word out quickly and we have come to rely on getting a phone call or an email from our ADT system. As with all technology, it sometimes has a glitch or just simply fails. If you think there is a possibility that school will be cancelled or postponed and you haven't gotten a call, please check the television stations and the Hodgeman County Schools Facebook page. We are going to try to get it put on the Rocking M radio stations as well. I sincerely apologize to those that did not get a call recently that we were having a late start. If one avenue fails, we always have a backup so please check all available methods. If you don't get a call, please phone me at 620-357-8301 to let me know. Thank you.

Christina Cohoon

post_text: The Hodgeman County High School Longhorn football team is “FIRED UP AND READY” for the state playoff in Newton on Saturday. You are invited to attend a public bonfire and pep rally on Thursday, November 21 in the lot east of the high school building. The bonfire and rally will begin at 7:00, weather permitting. If inclement weather, the rally will be held in the new high school gymnasium. Come to the bonfire to help get our Longhorns “FIRED UP AND READY!”
text: The Hodgeman County High School Longhorn football team is “FIRED UP AND READY” for the state playoff in Newton on Saturday. You are invited to attend a public bonfire and pep rally on Thursday, November 21 in the lot east of the high school building. The bonfire and rally will begin at 7:00, weather permitting. If inclement weather, the rally will be held in the new high school gymnasium. Come to the bonfire to help get our Longhorns “FIRED UP AND READY!”

post_text: The Lady Longhorn Volleyball team is headed to Substate in Satanta Saturday. There will be a send off for them at 1:15 pm. We will meet at MAP Inc. at 1:00 pm to prepare. Join us in showing support and Longhorn Pride by lining the highway south of town, displaying flags, colors, signs, etc. Good Luck Lady Longhorns!

post_text: Today is School Bus Drivers' Appreciation Day in Kansas. Each year, Kansas school bus drivers transport more than 200,000 students in excess of 66 million miles. Tell your driver, weather it be activity bus or route bus driver, how much you appreciate the job they do.
text: Today is School Bus Drivers' Appreciation Day in Kansas. Each year, Kansas school bus drivers transport more than 200,000 students in excess of 66 million miles. Tell your driver, weather it be activity bus or route bus driver, how much you appreciate the job they do.

post_text: Update on the sports for the week... Jr high volleyball finished their season on Monday against Spearville25-14, 24-26, 23-25. JV football beat South Central on Monday 46-0. Last night in Minneola, the Lady Longhorn varsity squad went 1-1 and the jv squad went 2-0. Good job to all the athletes this week!

post_text:
Congratulations to the HCHS Cross Country Team!

Christian Schuler placed 2nd in Cross Country League and received All-League Honors with a time of 17:49.24.

Gemma Kreger placed 3rd in the JV race with a time of 21:33.53, and Molley Fagen placed 9th in the JV race with a time of 24:56.34. She improved her best time of the year by 3 minutes.
text:
Congratulations to the HCHS Cross Country Team!

Christian Schuler placed 2nd in Cross Country League and received All-League Honors with a time of 17:49.24.

Gemma Kreger placed 3rd in the JV race with a time of 21:33.53, and Molley Fagen placed 9th in the JV race with a time of 24:56.34. She improved her best time of the year by 3 minutes.
